alert.note: Alert for Southern Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 11 at 9:49AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwestern Connecticut, including the following areas, Northern Litchfield and Southern Litchfield. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving showers and thunderstorms this afternoon into this evening may produce excessive rainfall leading to accumulations of 1 to 3 inches in a short period of time. This may result in urban, small stream or poor drainage flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
